name: Congenital Chylothorax with Refractory Hypoproteinemia
chief_complaint: Baby has difficulty breathing and looks pale
prognosis: Guarded; depends on response to treatment and underlying cause. May require prolonged NICU stay with risk of complications like infections or malnutrition.
description: A rare condition where lymphatic fluid (chyle) accumulates in the pleural space due to malformation or trauma to thoracic duct. The severe hypoproteinemia results from ongoing loss of proteins in chyle. Often presents in first week of life with respiratory compromise.
